author: Staff Reporter
text:
A fisherman from Veerampattinam died after he tripped and fell into a marsh while allegedly fleeing from police at Nallavadu near here on Wednesday night. The deceased has been identified as Vimal (33), a resident of Shivaji Nagar in Veerampattinam.

The police had registered a case against 11 persons in connection with the defacement of the foundation stone and the fence at the site allotted to the Coast Guard for setting up a hoverport on Wednesday.

On information that a few of the suspects were hiding at Nallavadu village, a police team rushed to the area on Wednesday night. On seeing the police vehicle, a group of fishermen took to their heels while a few others managed to escape with their boats into the sea. Vimal who ran along the backwaters accidentally tripped and fell into a marsh between Panithittu and Nallavadu villages.

His body was recovered by the Thavalakuppam police on Thursday. As the news of Vimal’s death spread fishermen held the police responsible.

Police sources said that the real cause of Vimal’s death will be known after the post-mortem report.
title: Fisherman falls into marsh, dies
